channel.title: OpenAIM
channel.description:
http://dev.aol.com/aim/
I thought this is a really good move for AIM, neat I say. And just when I was thinking about making a bot to listen for aim messages on a dedicated server, now it'll be easy as hell.

item.title: OpenAIM
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:12, topic:186688”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=249161.msg2092856#msg2092856 date=1204880244]

“And just when I was thinking about making a bot to listen for aim messages on a dedicated server, now it’ll be easy as hell.”
So you could just set up your own AIM server and start logging? Or am I misunderstanding…

Regardless of whether or not you’re understanding, how is that “east to hax”?

Perhaps I should have used a less 4chanish dialect, I do apologize. I was intending to say that if anybody could set up an AIM server and ‘hack’ other peoples conversations by listening in on them, it’s not exactly secure…
[/quote]

I’m over 9000 sure he was intending to set up a client on a dedicated server to listen for people chatting to him…[/quote]

Yes, this is what I intended because I don’t like leaving my computer on.

And you can use this API to make clients, not servers. (I guess you could write a server based on the protocol, but only your client would connect to it like Mopman said)

item.title: OpenAIM
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“unlimitedorb, post:10, topic:186688”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=249161.msg2092628#msg2092628 date=1204874261]
“And just when I was thinking about making a bot to listen for aim messages on a dedicated server, now it’ll be easy as hell.”
So you could just set up your own AIM server and start logging? Or am I misunderstanding…
[/quote]

Sigh Misunderstanding.
Moparisthebest meant that he wanted to setup a bot server that would listen on the network for incoming AIM messages. Once recieved, the bot can respond to them in whatever way Moparisthebest planned for it. Examples include: respoding with a simple “Hi”, returning movie quotes, or automatically providing the weather for your location, etc.

Before now, the Oscar protocol was closed source. Although it was undocumented, people were still able to go through and understand AIM sessions and then reverse engineer it to setup bots that auto responded to other peoples messages among other things.[/quote]

I think what Mopar referred to would be writing a CLIENT that talked to users, a la an IRC bot.

What you were talking about… is not possible.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:4, topic:186688”]“And just when I was thinking about making a bot to listen for aim messages on a dedicated server, now it’ll be easy as hell.”
So you could just set up your own AIM server and start logging? Or am I misunderstanding…[/quote]

Sigh Misunderstanding.
Moparisthebest meant that he wanted to setup a bot server that would listen on the network for incoming AIM messages. Once recieved, the bot can respond to them in whatever way Moparisthebest planned for it. Examples include: respoding with a simple “Hi”, returning movie quotes, or automatically providing the weather for your location, etc.

Before now, the Oscar protocol was closed source. Although it was undocumented, people were still able to go through and understand AIM sessions and then reverse engineer it to setup bots that auto responded to other peoples messages among other things.
